lemma nonbossy_Pd:
  assumes "nonbossy ds \<phi>"
  assumes "mechanism_domain Pd' Ch'"
  assumes "mechanism_domain (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch'"
  assumes "dX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) d = dX (\<phi> (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch' ds) d"
  assumes "d \<in> ds"
  shows "\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch' ds"

lemma nonbossy_Ch:
  assumes "nonbossy ds \<phi>"
  assumes "mechanism_domain Pd' Ch'"
  assumes "mechanism_domain Pd' (Ch'(h:=Ch''))"
  assumes "hX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) h = hX (\<phi> Pd' (Ch'(h:=Ch'')) ds) h"
  shows "\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> Pd' (Ch'(h:=Ch'')) ds"

lemma xs:
  shows "distinct [d1h1, d1h2, d1h3, d2h1, d2h2, d2h3, d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"

lemma BPd_BCh_mechanism_domain:
  shows "mechanism_domain BPd BCh"

lemma BPd_simps:
  "BPd d1 = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]"
  "BPd d2 = linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]"
  "BPd d3 = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"
  "d \<notin> {d1, d2, d3} \<longleftrightarrow> BPd d = {}"

lemma BCh_simps:
  "BCh h1 = mkhord [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1]"
  "BCh h3 = mkhord [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]"
  "h \<notin> {h1, h3} \<Longrightarrow> BCh h X = {}"

lemma Bossy_CD_on_Cd:
  shows "Bossy.CD_on ds X = Bossy.Cd d1 X \<union> Bossy.Cd d2 X \<union> Bossy.Cd d3 X" (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma Bossy_CH_BCh:
  shows "Bossy.CH X = BCh h1 X \<union> BCh h3 X" (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma Bossy_CH_range:
  assumes "X \<subseteq> Bossy.CH X'"
  shows "X \<subseteq> set [d1h1, d1h3, d2h1, d2h3, d3h1, d3h3]"

lemma Bossy_stable:
  shows "Bossy.stable_on ds X \<longleftrightarrow> X = {d1h1, d3h3}"
(*<*) (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma BPd'_BCh_mechanism_domain:
  shows "mechanism_domain BPd' BCh"

lemma BPd'_simps:
  "BPd' d1 = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]"
  "BPd' d3 = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"
  "d \<notin> {d1, d3} \<longleftrightarrow> BPd' d = {}"

lemma Bossy'_CD_on_Cd:
  "Bossy'.CD_on ds X = Bossy'.Cd d1 X \<union> Bossy'.Cd d3 X" (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma Bossy'_stable:
  shows "Bossy'.stable_on ds X \<longleftrightarrow> X = {d1h3, d3h1} \<or> X = {d1h1, d3h3}"
(*<*) (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma BPd'_BCh'_mechanism_domain:
  shows "mechanism_domain BPd' BCh'"

lemma BCh'_simps:
  "BCh' h1 = mkhord [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1]"
  "BCh' h2 = mkhord [d1h2, d2h2, d3h2]"
  "BCh' h3 = mkhord [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]"
  "h \<notin> {h1, h2, h3} \<Longrightarrow> BCh' h X = {}"

lemma Bossy''_CH_BCh':
  "Bossy''.CH X = BCh' h1 X \<union> BCh' h2 X \<union> BCh' h3 X" (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

lemma Bossy''_CD_on_range:
  assumes "X \<subseteq> Bossy''.CD_on ds X'"
  shows "X \<subseteq> set [d1h1, d1h2, d1h3, d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"

lemma Bossy''_stable:
  shows "Bossy''.stable_on ds X \<longleftrightarrow> X = {d3h1, d1h3}"
(*<*) (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

theorem Theorem_1:
  shows "\<not>(mechanism_stable ds \<phi> \<and> nonbossy ds \<phi>)"

theorem Theorem_1_COP:
  "\<not>nonbossy ds Contracts.cop"

lemma nonbossy_Pd:
  assumes "nonbossy ds \<phi>"
  assumes "mechanism_domain Pd' Ch'"
  assumes "mechanism_domain (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch'"
  assumes "dX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) d = dX (\<phi> (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch' ds) d"
  assumes "d \<in> ds"
  shows "\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> (Pd'(d:=Pd'')) Ch' ds"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch' ds
using assms

proof (prove)
using this:
  nonbossy ds \<phi>
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd' Ch'
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch'
  dX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) d = dX (\<phi> (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch' ds) d
  d \<in> ds

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch' ds
unfolding nonbossy_def

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<forall>Pd Pd' Ch.
      \<forall>d\<in>ds.
         ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd Ch \<and>
         ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh (Pd(d := Pd'))
          Ch \<longrightarrow>
         dX (\<phi> Pd Ch ds) d =
         dX (\<phi> (Pd(d := Pd')) Ch ds) d \<longrightarrow>
         \<phi> Pd Ch ds = \<phi> (Pd(d := Pd')) Ch ds) \<and>
  (\<forall>Pd Ch Ch' h.
      ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd Ch \<and>
      ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd
       (Ch(h := Ch')) \<longrightarrow>
      hX (\<phi> Pd Ch ds) h =
      hX (\<phi> Pd (Ch(h := Ch')) ds) h \<longrightarrow>
      \<phi> Pd Ch ds = \<phi> Pd (Ch(h := Ch')) ds)
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd' Ch'
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch'
  dX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) d = dX (\<phi> (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch' ds) d
  d \<in> ds

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> (Pd'(d := Pd'')) Ch' ds
by blast

  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd' (Ch'(h := Ch''))

goal (1 subgoal):

proof (prove)

  (\<forall>Pd Pd' Ch.

         ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh (Pd(d := Pd'))
          Ch \<longrightarrow>
         dX (\<phi> Pd Ch ds) d =
         dX (\<phi> (Pd(d := Pd')) Ch ds) d \<longrightarrow>
         \<phi> Pd Ch ds = \<phi> (Pd(d := Pd')) Ch ds) \<and>
  (\<forall>Pd Ch Ch' h.
      ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd Ch \<and>
      ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd
       (Ch(h := Ch')) \<longrightarrow>
      hX (\<phi> Pd Ch ds) h =
      hX (\<phi> Pd (Ch(h := Ch')) ds) h \<longrightarrow>
      \<phi> Pd Ch ds = \<phi> Pd (Ch(h := Ch')) ds)
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd' Ch'
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd' (Ch'(h := Ch''))
  hX (\<phi> Pd' Ch' ds) h = hX (\<phi> Pd' (Ch'(h := Ch'')) ds) h

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<phi> Pd' Ch' ds = \<phi> Pd' (Ch'(h := Ch'')) ds
by blast
end

text (in Contracts) \<open>

The proof is somewhat similar to those for Roth's impossibility
results (see, for instance, \citet[Theorem~4.4]{RothSotomayor:1990}).
It relies on the existence of at least three doctors, three hospitals,
and a complete set of contracts between these. The following locale
captures a suitable set of constraints.

\<close>

locale BossyConstants =
  fixes Xd :: "'x \<Rightarrow> 'd"
  fixes Xh :: "'x \<Rightarrow> 'h"
  fixes d1h1 d1h2 d1h3 :: 'x
  fixes d2h1 d2h2 d2h3 :: 'x
  fixes d3h1 d3h2 d3h3 :: 'x
  fixes ds :: "'d set"
  assumes ds: "distinct [Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1]"
  assumes hs: "distinct [Xh d1h1, Xh d1h2, Xh d1h3]"
  assumes Xd_xs:
    "Xd ` {d1h2, d1h3} = {Xd d1h1}"
    "Xd ` {d2h2, d2h3} = {Xd d2h1}"
    "Xd ` {d3h2, d3h3} = {Xd d3h1}"
  assumes Xh_xs:
    "Xh ` {d2h1, d3h1} = {Xh d1h1}"
    "Xh ` {d2h2, d3h2} = {Xh d1h2}"
    "Xh ` {d2h3, d3h3} = {Xh d1h3}"
  assumes dset: "{Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1} \<subseteq> ds"

locale ContractsWithBossyConstants =
  Contracts + BossyConstants
begin
abbreviation (input) "d1 \<equiv> Xd d1h1"
abbreviation (input) "d2 \<equiv> Xd d2h1"
abbreviation (input) "d3 \<equiv> Xd d3h1"
abbreviation (input) "h1 \<equiv> Xh d1h1"
abbreviation (input) "h2 \<equiv> Xh d1h2"
abbreviation (input) "h3 \<equiv> Xh d1h3"

lemma xs:
  shows "distinct [d1h1, d1h2, d1h3, d2h1, d2h2, d2h3, d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. distinct [d1h1, d1h2, d1h3, d2h1, d2h2, d2h3, d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]
using Xd_xs Xh_xs ds hs
by auto

text\<open>

We proceed to show that variations on the following preferences for
doctors and hospitals force a stable mechanism to be bossy. Recall
that @{const "linord_of_list"} constructs a linear order from a list of
elements greatest to least. The hospital choice functions take at most
one contract from those on offer, and are again ordered from most
preferable to least.

\<close>

definition BPd :: "'b \<Rightarrow> 'a rel" where
  "BPd \<equiv> map_of_default {} [ (d1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1])
                           , (d2, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1])
                           , (d3, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]) ]"

abbreviation mkhord :: "'d list \<Rightarrow> 'd cfun" where
  "mkhord xs X \<equiv> set_option (List.find (\<lambda>x. x\<in>X) xs)"

definition BCh :: "'c \<Rightarrow> 'a cfun" where
  "BCh \<equiv> map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {}) [ (h1, mkhord [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])
                                 , (h2, mkhord [])
                                 , (h3, mkhord [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]) ]"

text\<open>

Interpreting the @{const "Contracts"} locale gives us access to some
useful constants.

\<close>
interpretation Bossy: Contracts Xd Xh BPd BCh

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Contracts Xd Xh BPd BCh
using %invisible Xd_xs Xh_xs xs
unfolding BPd_def BCh_def
by unfold_locales (auto simp: linord_of_list_Linear_order)

lemma BPd_BCh_mechanism_domain:
  shows "mechanism_domain BPd BCh"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh BPd BCh
by %invisible unfold_locales (auto simp: BCh_def bilateral_substitutes_on_def irc_on_def)

lemma BPd_simps:
  "BPd d1 = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]"
  "BPd d2 = linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]"
  "BPd d3 = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"
  "d \<notin> {d1, d2, d3} \<longleftrightarrow> BPd d = {}"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (BPd (Xd d1h1) = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1] &&&
     BPd (Xd d2h1) = linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]) &&&
    BPd (Xd d3h1) = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3] &&&
    (d \<notin> {Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1}) = (BPd d = {})
unfolding BPd_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      (Xd d1h1) =
     linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1] &&&
     map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      (Xd d2h1) =
     linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]) &&&
    map_of_default {}
     [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
      (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
      (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
     (Xd d3h1) =
    linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3] &&&
    (d \<notin> {Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1}) =
    (map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      d =
     {})
using Xd_xs ds

proof (prove)
using this:
  Xd ` {d1h2, d1h3} = {Xd d1h1}
  Xd ` {d2h2, d2h3} = {Xd d2h1}
  Xd ` {d3h2, d3h3} = {Xd d3h1}
  distinct [Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1]

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      (Xd d1h1) =
     linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1] &&&
     map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      (Xd d2h1) =
     linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]) &&&
    map_of_default {}
     [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
      (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
      (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
     (Xd d3h1) =
    linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3] &&&
    (d \<notin> {Xd d1h1, Xd d2h1, Xd d3h1}) =
    (map_of_default {}
      [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
       (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
       (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])]
      d =
     {})
by auto

lemma BCh_simps:
  "BCh h1 = mkhord [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1]"
  "BCh h3 = mkhord [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]"
  "h \<notin> {h1, h3} \<Longrightarrow> BCh h X = {}"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. BCh (Xh d1h1) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])) &&&
    BCh (Xh d1h3) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3])) &&&
    (h \<notin> {Xh d1h1, Xh d1h3} \<Longrightarrow> BCh h X = {})
unfolding BCh_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
     [(Xh d1h1,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
      (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
      (Xh d1h3,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
     (Xh d1h1) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])) &&&
    map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
     [(Xh d1h1,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
      (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
      (Xh d1h3,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
     (Xh d1h3) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3])) &&&
    (h \<notin> {Xh d1h1, Xh d1h3} \<Longrightarrow>
     map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
      [(Xh d1h1,
        \<lambda>X.
           set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
       (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
       (Xh d1h3,
        \<lambda>X.
           set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
      h X =
     {})
using Xh_xs hs

proof (prove)
using this:
  Xh ` {d2h1, d3h1} = {Xh d1h1}
  Xh ` {d2h2, d3h2} = {Xh d1h2}
  Xh ` {d2h3, d3h3} = {Xh d1h3}
  distinct [Xh d1h1, Xh d1h2, Xh d1h3]

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
     [(Xh d1h1,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
      (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
      (Xh d1h3,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
     (Xh d1h1) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])) &&&
    map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
     [(Xh d1h1,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
      (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
      (Xh d1h3,
       \<lambda>X.
          set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
     (Xh d1h3) =
    (\<lambda>X.
        set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3])) &&&
    (h \<notin> {Xh d1h1, Xh d1h3} \<Longrightarrow>
     map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
      [(Xh d1h1,
        \<lambda>X.
           set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
       (Xh d1h2, \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
       (Xh d1h3,
        \<lambda>X.
           set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))]
      h X =
     {})
by auto

lemma Bossy_CD_on_Cd:
  shows "Bossy.CD_on ds X = Bossy.Cd d1 X \<union> Bossy.Cd d2 X \<union> Bossy.Cd d3 X" (is "?lhs = ?rhs")

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Bossy.CD_on ds X =
    Bossy.Cd (Xd d1h1) X \<union> Bossy.Cd (Xd d2h1) X \<union>
    Bossy.Cd (Xd d3h1) X
proof(rule equalityI)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. Bossy.CD_on ds X
    \<subseteq> Bossy.Cd (Xd d1h1) X \<union> Bossy.Cd (Xd d2h1) X \<union>
                Bossy.Cd (Xd d3h1) X
 2. Bossy.Cd (Xd d1h1) X \<union> Bossy.Cd (Xd d2h1) X \<union>
    Bossy.Cd (Xd d3h1) X
    \<subseteq> Bossy.CD_on ds X
show "?lhs \<subseteq> ?rhs"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Bossy.CD_on ds X
    \<subseteq> Bossy.Cd (Xd d1h1) X \<union> Bossy.Cd (Xd d2h1) X \<union>
                Bossy.Cd (Xd d3h1) X
unfolding Bossy.CD_on_def

proof (prove)

text\<open>

The second preference order has doctor @{const "d2"} reject all
contracts and is otherwise the same as the first.

\<close>

definition BPd' :: "'b \<Rightarrow> 'a rel" where
  "BPd' = BPd(d2 := {})"
interpretation Bossy': Contracts Xd Xh BPd' BCh

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Contracts Xd Xh BPd' BCh
using %invisible Xd_xs Xh_xs xs
unfolding BPd_def BPd'_def BCh_def

  shows "mechanism_domain BPd' BCh"

proof (prove)

by %invisible unfold_locales (auto simp: BCh_def bilateral_substitutes_on_def irc_on_def)

lemma BPd'_simps:
  "BPd' d1 = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]"
  "BPd' d3 = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]"
  "d \<notin> {d1, d3} \<longleftrightarrow> BPd' d = {}"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. BPd' (Xd d1h1) = linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1] &&&
    BPd' (Xd d3h1) = linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3] &&&
    (d \<notin> {Xd d1h1, Xd d3h1}) = (BPd' d = {})
unfolding BPd_def BPd'_def

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ((map_of_default {}
       [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
        (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
        (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])])
     (Xd d2h1 := {}))
     (Xd d1h1) =
    linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1] &&&
    ((map_of_default {}
       [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
        (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
        (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])])
     (Xd d2h1 := {}))
     (Xd d3h1) =
    linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3] &&&
    (d \<notin> {Xd d1h1, Xd d3h1}) =
    (((map_of_default {}
        [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
         (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
         (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])])
      (Xd d2h1 := {}))
      d =
     {})
using Xd_xs ds

proof (prove)
using this:
  Xd ` {d1h2, d1h3} = {Xd d1h1}
  Xd ` {d2h2, d2h3} = {Xd d2h1}

text\<open>

The third preference order adjusts the choice function of hospital
@{const "h2"} and is otherwise the same as the second.

\<close>

definition BCh' :: "'c \<Rightarrow> 'a cfun" where
  "BCh' \<equiv> BCh(h2 := mkhord [d1h2, d2h2, d3h2])"
interpretation Bossy'': Contracts Xd Xh BPd' BCh'

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Contracts Xd Xh BPd' BCh'
using %invisible Xd_xs Xh_xs xs
unfolding BPd_def BPd'_def BCh_def BCh'_def

proof (prove)
using this:
  Xd ` {d1h2, d1h3} = {Xd d1h1}
  Xd ` {d2h2, d2h3} = {Xd d2h1}
  Xd ` {d3h2, d3h3} = {Xd d3h1}
  Xh ` {d2h1, d3h1} = {Xh d1h1}
  Xh ` {d2h2, d3h2} = {Xh d1h2}
  Xh ` {d2h3, d3h3} = {Xh d1h3}
  distinct [d1h1, d1h2, d1h3, d2h1, d2h2, d2h3, d3h1, d3h2, d3h3]

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Contracts Xd Xh
     ((map_of_default {}
        [(Xd d1h1, linord_of_list [d1h3, d1h2, d1h1]),
         (Xd d2h1, linord_of_list [d2h3, d2h2, d2h1]),
         (Xd d3h1, linord_of_list [d3h1, d3h2, d3h3])])
      (Xd d2h1 := {}))
     ((map_of_default (\<lambda>_. {})
        [(Xh d1h1,
          \<lambda>X.
             set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h1, d2h1, d3h1])),
         (Xh d1h2,
          \<lambda>X. set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [])),
         (Xh d1h3,
          \<lambda>X.
             set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d3h3, d2h3, d1h3]))])
      (Xh d1h2 :=
         \<lambda>X.
            set_option (find (\<lambda>x. x \<in> X) [d1h2, d2h2, d3h2])))
by unfold_locales (auto simp: linord_of_list_Linear_order)

text\<open>

In particular, the COP (see \S\ref{sec:cop}) is bossy as it always
yields stable matches under @{const "mechanism_stable"}.

\<close>

theorem Theorem_1_COP:
  "\<not>nonbossy ds Contracts.cop"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> Bossy''.nonbossy ds
            (\<lambda>Pd Ch ds.
                Contracts.CH Ch (Contracts.fp_cop_F Pd Ch ds))
using ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC.Theorem_1 Theorem_1 mechanism_stable_def

proof (prove)
using this:
  ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC ?Xd ?Xh ?Pd ?Ch \<Longrightarrow>
  Contracts.stable_on ?Pd ?Ch ?ds
   (Contracts.CH ?Ch (Contracts.fp_cop_F ?Pd ?Ch ?ds))
  \<not> (Bossy''.mechanism_stable ds ?\<phi> \<and>
          Bossy''.nonbossy ds ?\<phi>)
  Bossy''.mechanism_stable ?ds ?\<phi> =
  (\<forall>Pd Ch.
      ContractsWithBilateralSubstitutesAndIRC Xd Xh Pd Ch \<longrightarrow>
      Contracts.stable_on Pd Ch ?ds (?\<phi> Pd Ch ?ds))

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> Bossy''.nonbossy ds
            (\<lambda>Pd Ch ds.
                Contracts.CH Ch (Contracts.fp_cop_F Pd Ch ds))
by blast
end

text\<open>

Therefore doctors can interfere with other doctors' allocations under
the COP without necessarily disadvantaging themselves, which has
implications for the notion of @{emph \<open>group strategy-proof\<close>}
\citep{HatfieldKojima:2009}; see \S\ref{sec:strategic-gsp}.

\<close>
end
